cricket_live_blog.display_title_landing_page: How Hardik Pandya's sensational last over helped India 'snatch victory from the jaws of defeat')
cricket_live_blog.title: How Hardik Pandya's sensational last over helped India 'snatch victory from the jaws of defeat'

details.content_title: We leave you with this video from Bengaluru. The crowd goes berserk as India clinch the thriller..

The scenes in the crowd from that last ball.. Incredible reaction! #IND #BAN #WT20 pic.twitter.com/hE5Ywh0CLF

— ICC (@ICC) March 23, 2016

It was a nerve wrecking game. India were lucky to finish on the winning side after the blunders they made on the field. It all came down to handling the pressure at the end and who better than MS Dhoni and his boys could do it. India now have four points from two matches and they are alive.
The Indian skipper credits Bumrah and Pandya for holding their nerves and coming up with tidy overs at the death

Bowlers did a great job and we were on top till the last three balls. Anyway, it is bad luck can't do much. Last three balls was where we lost. Specially it is disappointing today. We didn't play well against Pakistan, but played two good games: Mashrafe Mortaza

I think Bumrah bowled really well, the second over he bowled, he was under pressure that was because he had not fielded well. He did well to forget that and bowl the crucial 19th over. They were cruising and we used our proper bowlers and that made a difference. Overall, very good bowling effort. There were quite a few stuff we were discussing. We didn't want Pandya to bowl the yorker, it had to be back of a length and what field should it be. His execution of the last delivery was excellent: MS Dhoni

This was the moment that won it for India! LIVE: https://t.co/MWmOXskf3t #INDvBAN #WT20 pic.twitter.com/AVWgbqnEOa

— ICC (@ICC) March 23, 2016
Ashwin had asked Bumrah to do a mankad. Can you believe that?
He had put down a catch, he was 2 overs for 22, he was down, but Bumrah came back for us. I probably gave him a cheeky idea to try a mankad in the end. We might have taken flak, but why not?
We never really got together and worried so much, says R Ashwin. He credits the Bangladesh team for putting up a brave show
R Ashwin is the Player of the Match

What have you done Bangladesh!! India kept their cool.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) March 23, 2016

The legend of Dhoni just grew!

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) March 23, 2016
India have beaten Bangladesh by 1 run. What a thriller this was. Bangladesh should be lauded for a spirited effort. They were almost there.. India stay alive in the tournament

19.6 overs: The record stays. MS Dhoni proves he is the master behind the stumps. Ice-cool, brilliant thinking from Dhoni. He was sane enough to think under such pressure. India maintain their T20I record against Bangladesh. IND 5 - BAN 0
19.6 overs: Is it over? Good ball from Pandya. Bowled it wide, Dhoni ran in and broke the stumps. The match boils down to a third umpire decision
The Indians are taking their time on the field..
2 from 1..
Dhoni is still making changes on the field
2 from 1, 2 from 1...

19.5 overs: OUT! Mahmudullah is gone, tried to clear the mid-wicket fence but found Jadeja in the deep. Good catch under pressure from Jadeja. 2 runs needed off 1 ball. Hardik is on-a-hat-trick now. BAN 145/8
Shuvagata Hom in at No 9. Are we going to see a super over here?
Mahmudullah has got the strike now. BAN 145/7
19.4 overs: OUT! A wicket for Pandya here. Short ball again and Mushfiqur plays a glamour short to see himself walking back to the hut. Bangladesh need two runs from two balls
19.3 overs: Four! Cheeky! Scoop shot from Mushfiqur and the balls runs past Dhoni to the fence. 2 runs from 3 balls. Musfiqur is already celebrating
Pandya can't afford to bowl these length balls
19.2 overs: Four! Length ball and Mushfiqur slaps it to the cover boundary. Six off four balls. Bangladesh are looking good to beat India for the first time in T20Is
There is a long conversation between Dhoni and Pandya.

Top over under pressure from Bumrah. Couldn't have done more for Pandya who has to bowl the last.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) March 23, 2016
19.1 overs: Single, 10 from 5
Mahmudullah on strike. He is a cool customer
Hardik Pandya to bowl the final over. 11 runs from 6 balls. Mahmudullah and Rahim at the crease - two experienced campaigners
18.6 overs: A single off the last ball. A brilliant penultimate over from Bumrah. Six runs off it. Fantastic stuff!

India have defended this total with some spirit. But the catches dropped will hurt them

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) March 23, 2016
18.5 overs: Another single, good work on the field from Rohit. 12 needed from 7 now
18.4 overs: Pitched up and another single. 13 runs from 8 balls  now. This is turning out to be a thriller
18.3 overs: Third single off the over. The third umpire checked for a run-out and Rahim was safe by an inch. BAN 133/6
18.1 overs: Yorker again, single, one run. 16 needed from 11
Dhoni has taken the gamble by asking Bumrah to bowl the 19th
Jasprit Bumrah into the attack now
Nehra is dissapointed with himself for bolwing a full-toss
17.6 overs: Four! An ice-cool Mahmuddulah pierces the off-side field to bring down India's hopes. Bangladesh now need 17 off 12. It's pressure on India now. BAN 130/6
Mushfiqur Rahim walks in for Bangladesh..
17.5 overs: OUT! Nehra bowls a full-toss but Sarkar slaps it straight to Virat Kohli at long on. The left-hander departs for 21. Crucial wicket this for India. BAN 126/6, need 21 from 13 balls
17.2 overs: Pitched short and Sarkar slaps it to the mid-wicket fence. Another boundary. Bangladesh need 23 from 16 balls
17.1 overs: Nehra to continue
Bumrah has been so consistent with his yorkers in the death. It now has given Dhoni hope to give one more to the battered bowler
16.6 overs: Brilliant over from Jasprit Bumrah. An over filled with yorkers. 7 runs off it. BAN 120/5
The fans are rooting for the home side now

Wicket falling. #slowmotion #WT20 pic.twitter.com/JAo8shdZwj

— ICC (@ICC) March 23, 2016
16.1 overs: Two runs off Bumrah's first ball. A not-so-brisk effort from Yuvraj costs an extra run
Jasprit Bumrah back into the attack. He has conceded 19 runs from his 2 overs
15.6 overs: Nine runs off Jadeja's over. Three runs after the six off the first ball. BAN need 34 from 24. BAN 113/5
`15.1 overs: SIX! Soumya Sarkar this time. Bangladesh are cruising here.
14.6 overs: Good over from the veteran pacer. Five runs off it. The asking rate is slowly climbing up. BAN 104/5
14.5 overs: One run, could have been more if not for Jadeja. This man has been brilliant on the field today. BAN 104/5
That was a class act from Ashwin. He should have got a couple more there
Ashish Nehra back into the attack, a crucial over this for both the teams
13.6 overs: Tight over from Jadeja. Three runs off it. Bangladesh need 48 from 36 now. BAN 99/5
Jadeja from the other end
12.6 overs: Brilliant over from Ashwin. One run and  a wicket off it. Four dot balls after the wicket fell. Ashwin finishes with 4-0-20-2. The pressure back on Bangladesh. BAN 96/5
12.1 overs: OUT! Big blow for Bangladesh. Ashwin removes Shakib Al Hasan, compromises for his drop catch. A beautiful ball from the off-spinner. Took the edge and landed in Raina's hands. BAN 95/5
11.6 overs: Eight off the over. Shakib is making the chase look simple here. The pitch has eased out a bit and the left-hander is making full use of it. BAN 95/4
11.4 overs: SIX! Shakib isn't holding back. This one was hit neatly into the stands. The equation now is 54 from 51. BAN 94/4
Mahmudullah walks in. Bangladesh have two experienced men in the middle. Crucial pair this for Bangladesh. India would be happy to see them walking back soon
India are hanging around, thanks to Jadeja's srike, They need to improve their efforts on the field to stand a chance here..
11.1 overs: OUT! Jadeja gets one more, removes Mashrafe Mortaza. The skipper's move hasn't worked out well. BAN 87/4
10.5 overs: SIX! Shakib is doing more damage. He flicks one into the mid-wicket stands. India are looking shocked. The crowd has gone mute. BAN 87/3
10.4 overs: Jadeja hits the stumps and appeals. It's an easy decision for the third umpire. Shakib is safe. BAN 81/3

10.3 overs: Dropped! Another one, India are dropping the game away here. This time it's Ashwin in the deep. An easy catch, the ball popped off the off-spinner's hands. India have been poor on the field today
Hardik back into the attack. He conceded 11 runs off his first over
The equation looks simple for Bangladesh now. They need 70 from 60 balls
10 overs: Bangladesh are scoring at 7.7 runs an over at the half-way mark. Bangladesh are looking set for causing an upset here. India need more wickets here.
9.5 overs: SIX! Mashrafe Mortaza comes down the wicket and hits one straight back Raina's head. The skipper is looking determined and pumped up. He wants to make a statement here. BAN 77/3
Mashrafe Mortaza comes in. Wise move this?

9.2 overs: OUT! Huge wicket this and it comes out of nowhere. Sabbir Rahman goes for 26. Suresh Raina gets the wicket. The credit should go the superman behind the stumps - MS Dhoni. He was alert and clipped the bails off when Sabbir just lost his balance. Replays showed the batsman's foot was on air when the bails flashed. BAN 69/3
Suresh Raina into the attack
8.6 overs: A dot-ball to end the over. Bangladesh are 67/2 in 9 overs. India need to cut down their scoring rate to stand a chance here. The match is heading Bangladesh's way
8.5 overs: Four! Again, edged again and it flies to the other side of the 'V'. Bangladesh are moving ahead here. Pandya is frustrated. BAN 67/2
8.4 overs: Four! Pandya bangs it in short and there is no fielder to stop the top-edge from Sabbir. BAN 63/2

Tricky. Have to bowl really well.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) March 23, 2016
Hardik Pandya into the attack. A medium pacer on this wicket?
8 overs: End of Jadeja's successful first over. BAN 56/2
Shakib Al Hasan into the attack. India need to get a few more here. Bangladesh have quite a few experienced batsmen to come

7.4 overs: OUT! Relief for India as Tamim walks back for 35. Jadeja strikes. The left-hander danced down the track and completely missed the ball and Dhoni is too good to offer Tamim an extra life BAN 55/2
7.1 overs: Jadeja into the attack. He needs to play an important role if India are thinking of staying alive in the tournament
Has the pitch eased off a little bit? These two batsmen are scoring at will

Sabbir Rahman has already hit 18 off 10. He is a dangerous batsman for Bangladesh. This partnership is already worth 42 runs off 28 balls. These two have scored at almost 10 runs an over. Nothing going India's way now. BAN are 53/1 off 7 overs.
6.1 overs Ashwin into the attack. Dhoni is forced to use his main-man here.. This has been a horrible first-six overs for India
Not been Bumrah's night so far. Conceded a boundary off the first ball, dropped Tamim and now 16 runs off the sixth over.
5.6 overs: Four! Another one. Tamim is ruthless against Bumrah here. BAN 45/0
5.5 overs: Four! poor bowling from Bumrah. This kid looks devastated now. Tamim gets an edge and the ball flies to the third-man boundary. IND 41/1
5.3 overs: Four! Tamim is hurting Bumrah more, smashes this one straight over the bowlers head. BAN 37/1
Bumrah to continue
Tamim has got two lives today. It might prove very costly for Team India today. Bumrah has been pathetic on the field today. BAN are 29/1 in 5 overs
4.6 overs: SIX! And there is the icing on the cake for Bangladesh. Ashwin drops it short and Sabbir deposits it into the mid-wicket stand
4.4 overs: Dropped! Bumrah can't get an easier chance than this, drops a sitter. Tamim gets a life.
Ashwin to continue..
Nehra has been a bit inconsistent today. He has conceded 15 from his two overs.
3.6 overs: Eight runs off Nehra's second over. BAN 20/1

2.6 overs: End of a very successful over from Ashwin - 2 runs and a wicket. The last two balls should have sent warning bells to the Bangladesh dug out. Ashwin landed it on the perfect spot and troubled Tamim. Sabbir into the new batsman now
The senior men's hockey team is at the Chinnaswamy stadium in Bengaluru cheering for Mahendra Singh Dhoni's men

#WT20 Men: Special BCCI Invitees - the @TheHockeyIndia members pic.twitter.com/VoOhCyswDL

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 23, 2016
Hardik Pandya is all pumped up. A good effort from the all-rounder there on the field, the bowling change has worked for India
2.2 overs: OUT! Ashwin doesn't take long to strike. Mithun tries to clear the long on boundary but Hardik Pandya takes a stunning catch. Mithun goes for 1. BAN 11/1
And there is Ravichandran Ashwin, Dhoni cannot resist using him on this track anymore
1.6 overs: Bumrah concedes just three runs and finishes a splendid over. BAN 9/0
1.4 overs: Bumrah has bowled three dot balls already
Dot balls are important for India to create pressure. The target is not big enough to concede easy singles.
1.1 overs: Bumrah to bowl the second over. No spin early on from India today
1 overs: Seven runs off the first over. Not a good start on the field for Team India
0.5 overs: Dropped! That was a chance for Nehra. Tamim slammed it back at him and Nehra couldn't hold on to it. BAN 6/0
0.2 overs: Tamim is back on his foot.

0.1 overs: Four! Shabby work on the field from Jasprit Bumrah, conceded three extra runs. Ashish Nehra, ball-watching, bumps into Tamim. The Bangladesh batsman goes down. The game has been stopped for a while now
Welcome back, the Bangladesh openers are making their way into the middle. Team India skipper MS Dhoni is having a brief chat with his men near the boundary rope
Mashrafe Mortaza has to be lauded for using his resources well. The Bangladesh bowlers have restricted India to an achievable total on this track.
44 dot balls were bowled by the Bangladesh bowlers. That's almost half of the innings. Is it going to cost Team India?

Seems Bangladesh read the pitch better than the home team this time. The Indian batsmen threw their wickets away at crucial stages in the innings. They should have got ten more runs. However, Bangladesh have to spot on with the bat to chase 147 on this track

87 runs were scored in the last 10 overs. Decent effort from Suresh Raina and Hardik Pandya has taken India to a competitive total. Nevertheless, Mashrafe Mortaza was brilliant with his field placings and bowling changes
20 overs: Another yorker from Mustafizur. Dhoni gets a double this time. India finish with 146/7.
19.5 overs: Dhoni hits one straight to the mid-off fielder. Denies a single
19.3 overs: Single from Ashwin. The crowd is roaring, Dhoni back on strike
19.2 overs: Four! Ashwin makes Mustafizur pay for bowling one down the leg. He gets a boundary off his first ball. IND 141/7

19.1 overs: OUT! Mustafizur cleans up Jadeja. A faster one from the left-arm bowler and Jadeja was beaten for pace. Jadeja goes for 12. IND 137/7. More importantly, Dhoni remains at the non-striker's end

Bangladesh have used the conditions beautifully. Have to say they are ahead at this stage.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) March 23, 2016
18.6 overs: 14 runs off the over. One over left for Team India. Can they get to 150. It's Mustafizur for Bangladesh. IND 137/6
18.5 overs: Four! Good shot from Jadeja once again, good placement yet again. This time he works a slow bouncer to the backward square leg boundary. Two in two for Jadeja. IND 136/6
18.4 overs: Four! Jadeja makes room for himself and beautifully places it past the point fielder. Much needed runs these for India. IND 132/6
18.2 overs: Four! Dhoni does it in his own style. He almost swings himself off his feet to hit a boundary through the covers. IND 127/6
18.1 overs: Make that 42. Al Amin bowls another good yorker
India have played out 41 dot ball in this innings so far. The Bangladesh bowlers have been brilliant with yorkers today
17.6 overs: A yorker to end a fantastic over. Mustafizur has been brilliant today. Only five runs off the 18 th over. India are getting themselves into a danger situation here. IND 123/6
17.5 overs: Mahendra Singh Dhoni brings up 1000 T20I runs with a single. The Indian skipper has taken 66 matches to get there. He hasn't scored a fifty in T20I cricket so far.

Another blinder from Soumya Sarkar. Has to be among the better deep catchers in the game.

— Harsha Bhogle (@bhogleharsha) March 23, 2016
17.3 overs: Mustafizur is mixing it up well - slower balls, yorkers. Jadeja is not able to hit the big ones. Three runs of the first three so far. IND 121/6
The pitch report these days are just a joke. Tom Moody at the pitch assessment earlier today said the ball would come on to the bat nicely. And look at what has happened now
Mustafizur into the attack. He is generally good at the death. He has two over left here
17 overs: Four runs off Mahmudullah's over. Mashrafe should be happy. India are not being wise here, losing wickets in a hurry. IND 118/6
16.5 overs: OUT! Yuvraj played a nothing shot to walk back to the pavillion. Mahmudullah-move has worked in favour of Bangladesh. IND 117/6
16.1 overs: Dhoni gets a single and the left-hander Yuvraj to face the off-spinner. Mahmudullah will be happy to bowl at Yuvraj
Mahmudullah into the attack. Dhoni is having the strike. Brave move from Mashrafe

15.6 overs: Three dot balls to end a highly successful over. Indian batsmen have not been wise with their shot selection today. They need to get to 140 to give something for their bowlers. Bangladesh have done very well with the ball and on the field so far. IND 114/5
15.3 overs: No hat-trick for Al Amin. Yuvraj tucks the ball off his pads to get a two. IND 114/5
Pandya didn't have to play that shot. However, he was in the mood to go after everything
Yuvraj to face the hat-trick ball

15.2 overs: OUT! Stunning catch in the deep from Soumya Sarkar to dismiss the dangerous Pandya. Al Amin on-a-hat-trick now. Pandya tried to hit one to the mid-wicket fence but Sarkar takes a brilliant one-handed catch to end Pandya's cameo
Skipper Dhoni walks in
Looking at the way the game has progressed so far, it's fair to say Raina has played a good part here. 30 off 23 is not bad at all on this track
15.1 overs: OUT! Suresh Raina falls for a short ball again. He tries to hit a big one off Al Amin but succumbs. IND 112/4
Pandya is doing what he was expected to do. 15 runs from 6 balls so far.
14.6 overs: Four! Pandya at it again. This time he comes down the track and smashes it to the cover boundary. IND 112/3
14.5 overs: Four! Pandya is in the mood to hit the big ones here. Hits one straight down the ground. IND 108/3
14.2 overs: Pandya to face Shakib
Important for Pandya to continue hitting the big ones. A cameo from him might prove too valuable for the team. The young man has got the backing from the skipper.
13.6 overs: SIX! Pandya into the action straightaway. Hits a big six to finish an eventful over. IND 101/3
MS Dhoni has a surprise! He has sent Pandya in at No 5

13.4 overs: OUT! Big wicket for Bangladesh. Shuvagata snares Kohli. The right-hander played it across the line and paid for it. That was a quicker one from the off-spinner. Chinnaswamy has been muted now. IND 95/3
13.3 overs: SIX! First boundary for Virat Kohli. Shuvagata bolwed a full-toss. Kohli deposits into the mid-wicket stands
13.1 overs: Four! Much needed for India. Raina comes down the track and hits it straight. Pressure on Shuvagata IND 88/2
Shakib has been brilliant. He is focused on firing in the yorkers to both the batsmen. India are now scoring at a rate of 6.46. They should push the scoring rate up
12.6 overs: Five runs from the over. Shakib did very well to keep Kohli and Raina quiet. IND 84/2
12.3 overs: Suresh Raina has changed his bat again. A heavier one this time? The bowlers are not giving any pace for the batsmen to work with here. Clever from Bangladesh
12.1 overs: Shakib Al Hasan to continue. He has conceded seven runs from his 2 overs
11.6 overs: Another tidy over from Mortaza. He has kept the pressure on the Indian batsmen. IND 79/2
11.1 overs: Mortaza continues with the keeper standing up to the stumps
10.6 overs: 14 runs off the over. Raina is slowly finding his timing. It's important he gets into the groove. IND 73/2
10.5 overs: SIX! Two in two. Deposits one into the mid-wicket stand again. It was timed better this time. IND 73/2
10.4 overs: SIX! First boundary in 30 balls, Raina clips one off his hips into the mid-wicket stands. IND 67/2
10.2 overs: Dropped! Al Amin puts down one off Virat Kohli. Tough chance. Tried it with one hand. There was no timing on the shot. He should have taken it
10.1 overs: Al Amin into the attack

Bangladesh bowlers have made use of the conditions on offer well. India lost two wickets in the first ten overs and are struggling to get going. A good stand between these two in the middle is a necessity for Team India now
9.6 overs: Raina mistimes once again. Lucky again, gets a single. 7 runs from the tenth over. IND 59/2
9.5 overs: The wicketkeeper is standing up to prevent Virat walking down the track. He gets a single though
Look at Virat Kohli on this track, the difference between Raina and Kohli's battting. The latter looks completely in control
9.3 overs: Mashrafe Mortaza completely deceives Suresh Raina with a slower ball. Lucky Raina didn't find a fielder.
Virat Kohli's T20I average reads 53.6. The second-placed Aaron Finch has an average of 39.8. India need this man to fire today
"India need to calm down," says Sanjay Manjrekar. India are 52/2 at the end of nine overs. Bangladesh have conceded only 10 runs in the last three overs. Pressure on India now.
How much should India score on this track. The ball is holding up a bit. 150-160 may be?
8.1 overs: The off-spinner Shuvagata into the attack now
Bangladesh have not let India get off to a flyer. They have picked up two wickets early in the innings. A lot of bowling changes from skipper Mortaza
7.6 overs: Mashrafe was spot on in the last over. Four runs and three dot balls off it. This has been a shaky start for India. IND 49/2
7.1 overs: Mashrafe Mortaza continues..
Both the openers are back in the hut now. The onus once again is on Virat Kohli. Can he deliver today? Suresh Raina has joined the right-hander
6.6 overs: OUT! Shikhar Dhawan walks back to hut for 23. It was full delivery from Shakib and it hit Dhawan on the foot. Looked out. The umpire though took a long time to raise his finger. IND 45/2
Virat Kohli is the new man in. Shakib is continuing. A good reception for the Royal Challengers Bangalore skipper
That over from Mustafizur went for 15 runs but he was able to pick up the big wicket of Rohit

5.6 overs: OUT! Not good thinking from Rohit Sharma. Tries to hit the third six in the over that already saw them scoring 15 runs. He tries to hit one to the mid-wicket boundary, gets a top edge and Sabbir Rahman takes an easy catch. India lose their first wicket. IND 42/1
5.4 overs: SIX! It's Dhawan this time. He was able to pick up a slower one from Mustafizur and deposit into the mid-wicket stands. The ball travelled 83 m. IND 41/0
It's noisy out there at Chinnaswamy stadium
5.2 overs: SIX! Rohit is taking up the task of accelerating. He hits one straight over Mustafizur's head. IND 34/0
Will this slow start have an effect in the outcome of the match?
5 overs: Good over from Shakib. Four runs off it. India have to accelerate here. The run-rate is less than run-a-ball now. IND 27/0
4.4 overs: Shakib nearly sent Rohit walking back. Rohit checks his shot to a slower ball from Shakib and it just fell a bit short of the left-arm spinner IND 26/0
4.1 overs: Shakib Al Hasan into the attack. Bangladesh have used five different bowlers for the first five overs. And they haven't done bad so far
3.6 overs: Four! Shikhar Dhawan spoils Mustafizur's over. He leaks a boundary of the last ball - a poor one on the pads. Dhawan flicked it to the mid-wicket boundary IND 23/0
3.5 overs: Shikhar dances down the track only to see the ball crashing into his pads. He failed to read an off-cutter from Musrafizur
3.4 overs: Bangladesh have already saved a couple of boundaries by having men at the right positions on the field. Dhawan and Rohit are being given easy singles though
3.1 overs: Mustafizur Rahman into the attack. Watch out for his slower balls, the off-cutters
3 overs: Eight runs from the last over. India should look to make good use of the powerplay. IND 17/0
2.5 overs: Quick single taken. This is good running from the two batsmen. IND 17/0
2.1 overs: Four! It's Rohit Sharma this time. Waits for the ball from Al-Amin and guides it past the point fielder. Quality shot! IND 13/0
1.4 overs: Four! Pitched short and Dhawan makes no mistake, sends it soaring to the mid-wicket boundary. IND 9/0
1.1 overs: Spin from the other end. Shuvagata Hom, the off-spinner, into the attack. And it's turning sharply straightaway
1 overs: Five runs of the first over. Four singles were taken. IND 5/0
0.4 overs: Three singles so far in the first four balls. There was a little bit of confusion in the middle between the two batsmen. IND 4/0
01. overs: Skipper Mortaza steams in with the new ball. Rohit Sharma slashes it to the deep-point fielder for just a single. Good field placement from Bangladesh IND 1/0
Stat Alert: Teams that have won the toss have gone on to win on 11 occasions out of 12 in the main round of this year's World T20 tournament

The stadium is already packed. It's a good test for Shikhar Dhawan today. He has looked out of sorts. It's important for him to get going here when there is less pressure, when the team is batting first
Mahendra Singh Dhoni didn't have the luck going his way at the toss

#BAN win the toss and will bowl first #WT20 #BANvIND pic.twitter.com/rAnDsTYbDr

— ICC (@ICC) March 23, 2016
Tamim Iqbal is back in the Bangladesh XI. A huge boost to Bangladesh's batting today
Here's a look at the two teams
India: Rohit Sharma, Shikhar Dhawan, Virat Kohli, Suresh Raina, Yuvraj Singh, MS Dhoni(w/c), Hardik Pandya, Ravindra Jadeja, Ravichandran Ashwin, Ashish Nehra, Jasprit Bumrah
Bangladesh: Tamim Iqbal, Soumya Sarkar, Mohammad Mithun, Sabbir Rahman, Shakib Al Hasan, Shuvagata Hom, Mahmudullah, Mushfiqur Rahim(w), Mashrafe Mortaza(c), Al-Amin Hossain, Mustafizur Rahman
India haven't made any changes to the squad. Dhoni says the team is looking good. This is the first time India are batting first in the tournament
Mashrafe Mortaza has gone ahead trusting the stats. India are batting first here.
Bangladesh have won the toss and have opted to bowl first.

Here's Tom Moody with the pitch report: This has been one of the better batting wickets in India. The par score is 170. It is a flat surface and has a nice covering of grass, the ball will come on to the bat. Captains tend to chase here.
The average score on this track is 173. Team winning the toss have chose to field 17 times out of 19 in Bengaluru
Five minutes to the toss. The stadium is filling up slowly. A must-win for Bangladesh this. India will be better placed if they win tonight's clash
Bangladesh are definitely good with their football skills

#BAN show off some good football skills during the warm up. #BANvIND #WT20 https://t.co/1n9HW8NpH0

— ICC (@ICC) March 23, 2016

Bangladesh will be hoping to get their star batsman Tamim Iqbal back in the side today. He missed the last game against Australia due to illness. He lit up the qualifiers with his maiden century against Oman. He will be key to Bangladesh's chances today
Skipper Mahendra Singh Dhoni is having a look at the wicket. Should India bat first or chase today? Your thoughts?

#WT20 Men: Captain @msdhoni taking a look at the pitch. #Ind play #Ban today at 1930 hrs IST pic.twitter.com/kiG9Z1ceWW

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 23, 2016
We're twenty minutes away from the toss. It's time for team huddle at the Chinnaswamy stadium

#WT20 Men: #TeamIndia pic.twitter.com/AA485G8qh3

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 23, 2016
Yuvraj Singh is gearing up for tonight's clash. He was involved in a crucial partnership with Kohli in the game against Pakistan. Will he fire today?

#WT20 Men: @YUVSTRONG12 is on his way for the warm-up pic.twitter.com/jrRyCnpBHe

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 23, 2016
Bangalore hasn't had any high-scoring games this tournament so far. Will there one tonight? Indian off-spinner Ravichandran Ashwin inspects the pitch at he M Chinnaswamy staidum

#WT20 Men: @ashwinravi99 inspects the pitch ahead of the match against #Ban pic.twitter.com/QRzQOvfVNa

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 23, 2016
Virat Kohli is the leading the troupe as Team India leaves for the stadium from the team hotel in Benglauru. The man looks set for another big one. How many of you think he will?

#WT20 Men: #TeamIndia is leaving for the stadium. #Ind play #Ban today at 1930 hrs ISThttps://t.co/00ESRaAHIZ

— BCCI (@BCCI) March 23, 2016
We're an hour away from the toss. Will India make any changes to the team against Bangladesh today?

Bangladesh also have never won a T20I against India. The last time these two teams met was during the Asia Cup T20 final earlier this month and the Men in Blue made light work of the Bangladesh unit to clinch the title
Here's what Shakib said at the press conference yesterday

Shakib has said that his team was wary of the match-winners in the Indian line-up. Kohli, according to him, is the key player today. The star Indian batsman has been in blazing form. The match-winning 55 against Pakistan on Saturday would have boosted his confidence.
Bangladesh need their main men to fire today. Shakib Al Hasan and Mahmudullah have to rise to the occasion if their team are thinking of causing an upset today.

Bangladesh, on the other hand, have lost two successive games and are yet to open their account at the World T20 tournament. The suspensions news of Taskin Ahmed and Arafat Sunny has shaken their unit and skipper Mashrafe Mortaza is lacking intent on the field.
India are a confident looking unit now. After losing their first game against New Zealand, they bounced back against arch-rivals are looking set for another win today in Bengaluru
How Hardik Pandya's sensational last over helped India 'snatch victory from the jaws of defeat'

cricket_live_blog.shortdescription: India beat Bangladesh by 1 run in a thriller at M Chinnaswamy stadium in Bengaluru to stay alive in ICC World Twenty20. (Live Scorecard)
